questions.question: The geese the Chief sees outside the hospital window symbolize

choices.answer: the idea that it is natural for a man to be an individual.
freedom
the Chief’s retreat from reality
Nurse Ratched’s power over the male patients

questions.question: The fishing trip is good for the men because

choices.answer: catching fish teaches them to be a team.
they laugh & regain some lost courage.
the Chief talks for the first time.
they become more manly by verbally harassing a young girl.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about McMurphy is unquestionably true?

choices.answer: psychopath: because he lacks judgment & actsimpulsively
a con man who acts only for his own selfish gains
lead a tough life with many fights, but his laugh is real
secretly in love with Nurse Ratched

questions.question: The orderlies abuse the patients by

choices.answer: cramming food into the chronics’ mouths
sexually abusing the men with thermometers
stealing money and cigarettes from their rooms
playing "bumper cars" with the chronics

questions.question: Which of the following incidents from the story is an example of irony?

choices.answer: Vera Harding is comfortable with her sexuality
Most acutes are voluntary, while McMurphy is forced
The Chief’s mother is a white woman
Nurse Ratched is friends with Billy Bibbit’s mother

questions.question: Cheswick and Billy both commit suicide because

choices.answer: they cannot go back to being“rabbits.”
Nurse Ratched makes their lives miserable b/c of McMurphy
They can't live with the idea of leaving the hospital

questions.question: Nurse Ratched keeps McMurphy on the ward after he pretends to watch the world series b/c

choices.answer: other staff members side with McMurphy
she is secretly in love with McMurphy
she knows if she moves him, he will then become a martyr
she truly wants what is best for McMurphy

questions.question: She is called “Ratched” and “Big Nurse” because

choices.answer: Chief thinks a lot of authority = physically large
“Ratched” sounds like the tool called a “ratchet.”
She uses her curves and large bust to sexually tease the men
Both Authority & the Tool

questions.question: McMurphy stops his battle with Nurse Ratched when

choices.answer: He learns about Electric Shock Therapy
He realizes she can keep him there forever
Cheswick commits suicide
He wins enough money gambling

questions.question: Sefelt refuses to take his seizure medication because

choices.answer: he does not want to look old
the medicine does not work
it tastes like chalk
he wants to die

questions.question: Which does NOT show the theme that sometimes rules need to be broken so a person can grow?

choices.answer: Taking the boat for a joyride
Rule-free Monopoly
Sneaking Candy into the Ward for Billy
The Chief makes everyone think he is deaf and dumb

questions.question: Which is NOT a way McMurphy tries to fluster Nurse Ratched with little rebellions?

choices.answer: Writing nonsense in the log
Licking his lips over and over in a suggestive way
Making crude remarks about her breasts
Writing rude messages on toliet seats

questions.question: The Chief first feels deaf and dumb

choices.answer: while in the army
as a child on the reservation
after his first electric shock therapy
after seeing his father drink himself to death

questions.question: Which of the following does the Chief believe is an example of the Combine at work?

choices.answer: All the new houses look the same
He regains his ability to speak and hear
The Indians are beginning to fish for salmon again
He tells a Mexican he is a professional wrestler

questions.question: The title of the novel

choices.answer: Is from one of Chief's hallucinations about flying
Is based on a pop song of the time
is based on a children's rhyme
is reflected in what Chief does at the end of the novel

questions.question: What does McMurphy promise the Chief if the Chief will agree to lift the control panel?

choices.answer: sex with Candy
to make the Chief big again
to give the Chief half of the profits from the wagers
all the whiskey he can drink

questions.question: What is the “Friday-night ringing” the Chief hears in his head?

choices.answer: Excitement because McMurphy is about to do something brave
The boys playing High School football and his lost youth
Church bells symbolizing the rules of society
Aftershocks from Electric Shock Therapy

questions.question: Whom does McMurphy blame for the situation at the hospital?

choices.answer: The voluntary inmates
Nurse Ratched
The doctors
The orderlies

questions.question: What are the first words the Chief uses?

choices.answer: "I am big"
"gum?"
"stop"
"thank you"

questions.question: The dog watching geese/sniffing squirrels being hit by a car represents what?

choices.answer: Ratched killing McMurphy
The freedom that the narrator longs for
What the Combine does to all animals
The Chief's inevitable fate
